page.title: 14Whitby Town Council.
page.content: The town is administered by{ {Scarborough Borough Council,}which took over the district on 1st April, 1974, much to the annoyance of{Whitby} residents.{Whitby Town Council} is an elected body, but apart from the{ {Pannett Art Gallery}and{Museum,}it has no official function, except to provide a very good sound-board for public opinion and forms an ideal host council to important visitors to the town. It can and does levy a rate to meet its own expenses. There are 18 councillors who meet once a month at the Eskholme Council Offices.They are elected every 4 years and a mayor is annually elected from among the body.Members serve on school governing bodies. Whitby Town is twinned with Whitby in Ontario,Anchorage in Alaska,Stanley in the Falkland Islands and Tonga.
